column5: Well all I can say is the Walleye fishing this summer on the Lower Grand has been hot ..Best  lures Big Os & Wally Divers Fat Raps 9 fow 2.7 mph ...seems all the spots That I have been trying have been producing nice walleye this year ...all shapes and size ...here are a few pictures of the past couple of days ...Few for the table and lots released for you to catch ... ;)If you don't own a big boat for Lake Erie nows the time to get the tin boats out for Walleye on the Lower Grand ....        The not Wanted  Ones LOL ;D
Nice fish Steve. How come the walleyes are so white (light colored)?
Awesome Report!! I'm heading out to Dunville for some Family Camping trip.... I can't wait for the fishing there!

Nice fish Steve, I see that wally diver in the one pic, is that the one with a light purple hue to it?  If so, do you carry that in your store?  It's a very good colour at BOQ as well and hard to find.
Real nice eyes Fishmaster Question on the BigO, what color were you catching them on?  Leechman
The pale ones are usually the river residing fish, and the ones that look normal are from erie.
Looks like some some great fishing (just look at those smiles!)! Those are some nice fish too....I can just taste those walleye now!
'Cause they live in a mud puddle and never see the light of day.
With action that hot somebody should open a charter business there. Jim
Should be more Eriedesient Wallydivers in this week
To Busy on Lake Erie Chartering for Big Walleye besides that  I would never charter for Walleye on the Grand ...I might keep 6 Walleye from the River all Year the rest are C&R
